author: minchau
msg: PR: bugzilla 5133
Submitted by:	Richard Cao
Reviewed by:	Brian Minchau
The following line was deletedt because nsNamespace is NOT the URI
for the xmlns prefix, so this setAttributeNS() causes problems
xslBuiltElem.setAttributeNS(nsNamespace, "xmlns:xsl", xslNamespace);
Another spot in the file had already commented out the same line.
Is testcase6() now "fixed". Can it be moved back into a bucket?

author: zongaro
msg: Patch from Christine Li (jycli@ca.ibm.com) for Bugzilla bug report 22167.
When the zero-argument constructor of DOMSource, StreamSource or SAXSource is
invoked, and no setter method is called to specify an actual source, the
source should be treated as if it contained only a root node.  This implies that
a DOMSource containing just a Document node should be legitimate for
transformation.
